meanings.sent1: The deafenings of the fireworks startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were filled with the deafenings of honking cars.
meanings.sent3: The deafenings of the baby's laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The deafenings of the storm outside made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The deafenings of the crowd at the concert echoed through the stadium.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone unable to hear by a loud noise
meanings.sent1: The deafenings caused by the explosion left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent2: The construction work resulted in constant deafenings for the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The prankster used a horn to create deafenings and scare his friends.
meanings.sent4: The deafenings of the alarm clock failed to wake up the heavy sleeper.
meanings.sent5: The deafenings from the speaker system made communication impossible.
